SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class TEST05_US020101_EventQRCodeUITest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.TEST05_US020101_EventQRCodeUITest
public class TEST05_US020101_EventQRCodeUITest extends Object
UI tests for US 02.01.01: As an organizer I want to create a new event and generate a unique promotional QR code that links to the event description and event poster in the app. These instrumented tests verify that:
  • Organizers can access the create event screen
  • Event creation form is displayed with all required fields
  • QR code can be viewed after event creation
  • QR code display screen shows the QR code image
Note: For reliable test execution, it's recommended to disable animations on the test device/emulator before running these tests: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 0
To re-enable animations after testing: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 1

    • organizer_canNavigateToCreateEventScreen

      public void organizer_canNavigateToCreateEventScreen()
      Test Case 1: Organizer can navigate to create event screen. As an organizer, I should be able to navigate to the create event screen where I can create a new event and generate a QR code.

    • organizer_createEventForm_displaysAllRequiredFields

      public void organizer_createEventForm_displaysAllRequiredFields()
      Test Case 2: Event creation form displays all required fields. As an organizer, when I navigate to create an event, I should see all the fields needed to create an event, including name and description which will be linked in the QR code.

    • organizer_canEnterEventName_inCreateForm

      public void organizer_canEnterEventName_inCreateForm()
      Test Case 3: Organizer can enter event name in the creation form. As an organizer, I should be able to enter an event name that will be associated with the event and accessible via the QR code.

    • organizer_canEnterEventDescription_inCreateForm

      public void organizer_canEnterEventDescription_inCreateForm()
      Test Case 4: Organizer can enter event description in the creation form. As an organizer, I should be able to enter an event description that will be linked in the QR code and viewable when the QR code is scanned.

    • organizer_canAccessPosterUpload_inCreateForm

      public void organizer_canAccessPosterUpload_inCreateForm()
      Test Case 5: Organizer can access poster image upload in creation form. As an organizer, I should be able to upload an event poster that will be linked in the QR code and viewable when the QR code is scanned.

    • organizer_createEventButton_displayedAndAccessible

      public void organizer_createEventButton_displayedAndAccessible()
      Test Case 6: Create event button is displayed and accessible. As an organizer, I should see a create event button that, when clicked, will create the event and generate a QR code.

    • organizer_qrCodeDisplay_showsQRCodeImageView

      public void organizer_qrCodeDisplay_showsQRCodeImageView()
      Test Case 7: QR code display screen shows QR code image view. As an organizer, when I view the QR code for my event, I should see the QR code image displayed on the screen. Note: This test assumes navigation to QRCodeDisplayFragment is possible. In a real scenario, you would need to have created an event first.

    • organizer_qrCodeDisplay_showsEventName

      public void organizer_qrCodeDisplay_showsEventName()
      Test Case 8: QR code display screen shows event name. As an organizer, when I view the QR code, I should see the event name displayed above the QR code to identify which event it belongs to.

    • organizer_qrCodeDisplay_hasShareAndRegenerateButtons

      public void organizer_qrCodeDisplay_hasShareAndRegenerateButtons()
      Test Case 9: QR code display screen has share and regenerate buttons. As an organizer, when viewing the QR code, I should see options to share the QR code and regenerate it if needed.

    • organizer_qrCodeDisplay_showsHeaderTitle

      public void organizer_qrCodeDisplay_showsHeaderTitle()
      Test Case 10: QR code header title is displayed correctly. As an organizer, when I view the QR code screen, I should see a clear header title indicating "Event QR Code".

    • organizer_canActuallyCreateEvent

      public void organizer_canActuallyCreateEvent()
      Test Case 11: Organizer can actually create an event. VERIFIES FUNCTIONALITY: Event is created and appears in hosted events list.

    • organizer_canNavigateFromCreateEvent_toViewQRCode

      public void organizer_canNavigateFromCreateEvent_toViewQRCode()
      Test Case 12: Organizer can navigate from create event to view QR code. VERIFIES FUNCTIONALITY: Creates event, navigates to event detail, and views QR code.

    • organizer_createEventForm_allowsEnteringAllQRCodeData

      public void organizer_createEventForm_allowsEnteringAllQRCodeData()
      Test Case 12: Event creation form allows entering all data needed for QR code. As an organizer, the event creation form should allow me to enter all the information (name, description, poster) that will be linked in the QR code.
